1.text: Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said,

2.text: If we assay to commune with you, will you be grieved? but who can withhold himself from speaking?

3.text: Behold, you have instructed many, and you have strengthened the weak hands.

4.text: Your words have upheld him that was falling, and you have strengthened the feeble knees.

5.text: But now it is come on you, and you faint; it touches you, and you are troubled.

6.text: Is not this your fear, your confidence, your hope, and the uprightness of your ways?

7.text: Remember, I pray you, who ever perished, being innocent? or where were the righteous cut off?

8.text: Even as I have seen, they that plow iniquity, and sow wickedness, reap the same.

9.text: By the blast of God they perish, and by the breath of his nostrils are they consumed.

10.text: The roaring of the lion, and the voice of the fierce lion, and the teeth of the young lions, are broken.

11.text: The old lion perishes for lack of prey, and the stout lionâ€™s whelps are scattered abroad.

12.text: Now a thing was secretly brought to me, and my ear received a little thereof.

13.text: In thoughts from the visions of the night, when deep sleep falls on men,

14.text: Fear came on me, and trembling, which made all my bones to shake.

15.text: Then a spirit passed before my face; the hair of my flesh stood up:

16.text: It stood still, but I could not discern the form thereof: an image was before my eyes, there was silence, and I heard a voice, saying,

17.text: Shall mortal man be more just than God? shall a man be more pure than his maker?

18.text: Behold, he put no trust in his servants; and his angels he charged with folly:

19.text: How much less in them that dwell in houses of clay, whose foundation is in the dust, which are crushed before the moth?

20.text: They are destroyed from morning to evening: they perish for ever without any regarding it.

21.text: Does not their excellency which is in them go away? they die, even without wisdom.
